item.title: Starting With Scala
item.description: Scala is a functional programming langugage. For years, I’ve always shied away from functional programming languages. I’ve done that becuase I always thought they were only really used by hard-core academic computer scientists to make themselves sound intelligent in front of others. I’ve found out recently there are some really fun and powerful things to be learned from functional languages, such as Scala. They’re fast, good for asynchronous operations, have low latency and because of that they are becoming more prevelant and sought after to meet the real-time, low-latency demands of today.

item.title: Deploying to Cloud with DigitalOcean + Docker
item.description: Containerization allows development teams to move fast, deploy software efficiently, and operate at an unprecedented scale. They are small They are fast They consume no more engergy than running an application They take up 100’s of times less space and memory than virtual machines Setup Optional Get a DO account https://m.do.co/c/e224d565e5ec - this link gives 100 USD credit. Install Docker - do before starting Docker Download - Mac
